original_fears: Student loan debt and financial stress
current_fears: Feeling inadequate during networking events with older professionals
Struggling to manage time between study groups and networking events
current_challenges: Juggling study group and coaching session
Attending networking events while keeping up with academic commitments
current_anxiety_triggers: Feeling the need to fight for space in conversations due to age difference

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Overthinking presentations and networking, 2) Fear of coming off as aggressive, 3) Comparing oneself to more confident peers. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Practicing presentations in low-pressure settings, 2) Using research-based questions for networking, 3) Focusing on genuine curiosity. Student's response to solutions: Positive engagement, planning to practice with roommate and draft networking questions. Evidence of progress/improvement: Shoulders relaxed during conversation, determined nod, and mental preparation for future networking.

fears_materialized.Student loan debt and financial stress: Worrying about post-graduation job prospects affecting loan repayment

challenges_materialized.Preparing for presentations: Overthinking delivery and comparing oneself to others during class presentations
challenges_materialized.Building time management: Juggling poli-sci club commitments with study schedules
challenges_materialized.Developing effective study habits: Procrastinating on assignments leading to last-minute stress
challenges_materialized.Balancing extracurricular activities wit: Attending career fairs while keeping up with coursework

behaviors_detailed.Exercises regularly: Maintains a workout routine to manage stress
behaviors_detailed.Attends career fairs: Actively participates in networking events despite anxiety
behaviors_detailed.Uses campus resources like tutoring: Utilizes tutoring services for academic support
behaviors_detailed.Procrastinates on assignments: Delays starting assignments until deadlines approach

triggers_specified.Job interviews: Anxiety about making a strong impression during interviews
triggers_specified.Networking events: Stress over initiating conversations at career fairs

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Mark's aggressive behavior at networking events due to feeling unheard and younger than others. Solutions offered/accepted: Using the FORD method for conversations, setting soft goals, and strategic exit lines. Student's response to solutions: Mark appreciated the advice, planned to rehearse FORD, and found exit strategies helpful. Evidence of progress/improvement: Mark demonstrated self-awareness, strategic preparation, and a positive response to the solutions, indicating readiness to apply them at future events.
